bullets: FREE custom 3D Fence & Concrete quotes that you can design, review and edit online!
Responsive, quick and friendly customer service from end-to-end!
Transparent pricing and our quality assurance.
Beautiful, high-quality Fence & Concretes for your property built by skilled local craftsmen.

Yelp.title: When I began my journey of looking for a company to assist me with my fencing project, I went online and it was lucky enough to find Ergeon. Within a day I received a call from Ergeon who was able to answer all the questions I had and was able to work with my busy schedule in setting up a video call with me to go over what I should expect. Diego was very helpful and willing to assist in anyway he can. He set me up with a quote for the whole project and also broke down the costs and what to expect (in case I decide to break the project into phases).
Yelp.name: Colleen G.
Yelp.description: Within a day I received a call from Ergeon who was able to answer all the questions

Google.title: My rep Andrea was EXTREMELY AWESOME and HELPFUL. She checked in with every step of the way to ensure that my job was completely dialed in and everything I wanted. She’s the main reason why I decided to go with Ergeon. Awesome customer service and support.
Google.name: Mike H.

regulations.title: Permits & Regulations
regulations.description: See the undefined Permits & Regulations for undefined

faq.front-yard: 3 feet within setback, 6 feet beyond 20 feet setback
faq.side-yard: 3 feet along the street side yard lot line or 6 feet if: 1) setback 10 feet from the street side property line, 2) setback 35-feet from the front property line, 3) located behind building’s front façade on the street side, 4) an 18-inch lattice may be added with Director approval and a building permit
faq.rear-max-height: 6 feet (an 18-inch lattice may be added with Director approval and a building permit)
faq.setback: measured from property lines. Property lines are typically located 10 feet behind the face of the curb and rarely correspond with the edge of the sidewalk
faq.corner-lot-rules: Corner Lots: Three (3) feet along the street side yard lot line or 1) A six (6) foot tall fence is allowed on the street side if it is, 2) Setback 10-feet from the street side property line 3) Setback 35-feet from the front property line, then a, 4) Located behind building’s front façade on the street side, 5) An 18-inch lattice may be added with Director approval and a building permit

articles.description: If you’re looking to get a new fence in California, it’s important to know about the laws surrounding fences and home improvement projects. Our post will go over some important things to keep in mind.

When it’s time to get a new fence it’s important to always use a reputable, licensed, and insured contractor. Some people try to cut costs by using unlicensed contractors, but this can end up being a major issue if any problems happen during the installation or down the line. In this post, we’ll go over the main reasons why you should always use a licensed and insured fence contractor.
